Detailed Description

This class provide methods for Alarm handle.

The AlarmManager class provides methods for managing the notify.

The following example demonstrates how to use the AlarmManager 

 MyPage::onInit(Persistence* const savedInstenceState){


  Context* context = new Context(this);

 //new the AlarmManager instance
 AlarmManager *mAM = new AlarmManager(Context);

 //new Alarm
 int flag = 0x10000000;
 Demand* demand = new Demand();
 demand->setClassName("com.example.notificationmanagertest", ".NotificationManagerTest");
 PendingDemand* rtcIntent = PendingDemand::getPageN(this, *demand, flag);

 //Alarm
 AM->set(AlarmManager::RTC_WAKEUP, System::currentTimeMillis() + 1000*5, *rtcIntent);
 }

Definition at line 48 of file AlarmManager.h.

anonymous enum
Enumerator:
RTC_WAKEUP 

Alarm time of (wall clock time in UTC), which will wake up the device when it goes off.

RTC 

Alarm time of (wall clock time in UTC).

This alarm does not wake the device up; if it goes off while the device is asleep, it will not be delivered until the next time the device wakes up.

ELAPSED_REALTIME_WAKEUP 

Alarm time of (time since boot, including sleep), which will wake up the device when it goes off.

ELAPSED_REALTIME 

Alarm time of (time since boot, including sleep).

This alarm does not wake the device up; if it goes off while the device is asleep, it will not be delivered until the next time the device wakes up.
